item.title: BNP demands release of teacher held over offensive remarks about Tarique
item.description: BNP on Saturday demanded the immediate and unconditional release of teacher AKM Shahidul Islam, who was arrested over allegations of making derogatory remarks about BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman. The party made the demand in a statement, signed by its Senior Joint Secretary General Ruhul Kabi

item.title: How TV shows like 'Mo' and 'Muslim Matchmaker' allow Arab and Muslim Americans to tell their stories
item.description: Whether it’s stand-up comedy specials or a dramedy series, when Muslim American Mo Amer sets out to create, he writes what he knows. The comedian, writer and actor of Palestinian descent has received critical acclaim for it, too. The second season of Amer's “Mo” documents Mo Najj

item.title: Myanmar polls open amid civil war
item.description: Overshadowed by civil war and doubts about the credibility of the polls, voters in Myanmar were casting their ballots in a general election starting on Sunday, the first since a military coup toppled the last civilian government in 2021. The junta that has since ruled Myanmar says the vote is a ch

item.title: Bus accident leaves 15 dead in Guatemala and government declares 3-day national mourning period
item.description: An intermunicipal bus veered off a road in Guatemala and fell into a deep ravine, killing 15 passengers and injuring at least 15 others, authorities said Saturday, and declared three days of national mourning. The accident happened Friday night outside the town of Totonicapan along a route known a

item.title: Iran’s president says his country is in a full-scale war with the West
item.description: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian said Saturday his country is in a full-scale war with the U.S., Israel and Europe ahead of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ’s meeting Monday with U.S. President Donald Trump. Pezeshkian said in an interview published on the website of the country

item.title: China issues draft rules to regulate AI with human-like interaction
item.description: China's cyber regulator on Saturday issued draft rules for public comment that would tighten oversight of artificial intelligence services designed to simulate human personalities and engage users in emotional interaction. The move underscores Beijing's effort to shape the rapid rollout of consume

item.title: MoYS submits Tk 2.01b Vehicle Driving Training Project to PC
item.description: The Ministry of Youth and Sports (MoYS) has submitted the DPP of the Vehicle Driving Training Project (Phase II), taken at an estimated cost of Tk 2.01 billion, to the Planning Commission (PC), aiming to expand the Department of Youth Development's (DYD) driving training programme for unemployed yo

item.title: Italy arrests nine over alleged Hamas funding through charities
item.description: Italian prosecutors said on Saturday they had arrested nine people on suspicion of financing Hamas through charities based in Italy, in an operation coordinated by anti-mafia and anti-terrorism units. The suspects are accused of "belonging to and having financed" the Palestinian group, which the E

item.title: Asaduzzaman resigns as attorney general to contest in parliamentary elections
item.description: Md Asaduzzaman has tendered his resignation as attorney general to the president, formally stepping down from the country’s top legal post. Deputy Attorney General Md Jahirlul Islam Sumon told bdnews24.com that Asaduzzaman handed in his resignation letter at the Attorney General’s Offi

item.title: Zubayer Rahman Chowdhury takes oath as Chief Justice
item.description: Justice Zubayer Rahman Chowdhury on Sunday took oath as the 26th Chief Justice of Bangladesh. President Mohammed Shahabuddin administered the oath at Bangabhaban at 10:30am on Sunday. Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus, among others, attended the oath-takig ceremony which was broadcast live by Ban

item.title: NBR extends income tax return deadline to January 31
item.description: The government has extended the deadline for submitting income tax returns for individual taxpayers for the second time for the 2025–26 tax year. According to an order issued by the National Board of Revenue (NBR), the return submission deadline has been extended from December 31, 2025 to Ja

item.title: More countries reject Israel's recognition of Somaliland
item.description: A growing number of countries on Saturday rejected Israel's recognition of Somalia’s breakaway region of Somaliland as an independent nation a day earlier, the first by any country in more than 30 years. It wasn't known why Israel made the declaration Friday or whether the country was expect
